video.title: Data Analytics Crash Course: Teach Yourself in 30 Days
video.description:
The course is an introduction to Python-based data analytics.

You will get a basic understanding of the workings of Python to the point where you can confidently find and manipulate data sources and use a Jupyter environment to derive insights from your data.

🔗 Course Website: https://stories.thedataproject.net/
💻 Code: https://github.com/dbclinton/jupyter_data

✏️ Course developed by David Clinton.

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (06:50) Installing Python and Jupyter 
⌨️ (09:35) Working with the Jupyter environment
⌨️ (12:05) Finding data sources and using APIs 
⌨️ (16:35) Working with data 
⌨️ (24:45) Plotting data 
⌨️ (32:45) Understanding data 

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 Treehouse

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

If you can show that you really learned, eg share your projects on GitHub, then you'll be a really strong candidate. 

The most pertinent advice (from the internet) I keep in mind is to have a sample project relevant to the company you're trying to get into.. you can typically have an idea of what they're looking for from the job posting..

topLevelComment.author: Demr
topLevelComment.text:
Hey anyone can help? I installed bls but it doesn't work in JupyterLab

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'bls'

replies.author: Rafael Nardi
replies.text:
The same happened to me and I might know how to solve it: Try to install the BLS module FROM the Anaconda Navigator CMD.Exe Prompt (not the regular cmd inside windows)
1 - Open Anaconda Navigator
2 - Click on the launch button for the cmd.exe prompt
3 - on the cmd screen, type pip install bls
4 - it should work

topLevelComment.author: Rhea
topLevelComment.text: i still don't understand about key API, anyone bother to explain me how to use it? i've got it i go to command, and idk what to do next

replies.author: Rhea
replies.text: @ryan brilliant ah thank you sm

replies.author: ryan brilliant
replies.text: @Rhea no , as you see in the video, bls are package for python that used in jupyter notebook for retrieve data from bls.gov site using API KEY. the key is imported not exported, you can find other key from https://bls.gov sites, just read the example code and you will know how to import it ( if the video aren't clear ) . if u haven't install or use jupyter notebook before, than i suggesting to install it first.

replies.author: Rhea
replies.text:
@ryan brilliant i have install bls but idk how to export the key do i need it to do it in cmd? and type bls.get... = 15xxxxxxxx...
?

replies.author: ryan brilliant
replies.text:
In this video the API key used for get the data from US Labor data. Normally the key go in some particular way just to get the data, but with "bls" package, it simplified to just write it in bls.get_series('API_KEY')  to get the data we want from US labor data.

In simple way its key to 'download' the data.

replies.author: TK
replies.text: @Rahul singh ohh okay thanksss :) also is front end good job option for women ?

replies.author: Rahul singh
replies.text: @TK front end is good and all but go for full-stack web development meaning front-end back-end and DevOps with cloud and all and yeah if you are doing it don't spend too much time on css , js and HTML  , css is ever learning process do some projects understand the concepts in it cheers

replies.author: TK
replies.text: @Miaow yes I know math is not imp but I was scared that if I choose front end dev and after choosing the course I find out that I am going to study math then that situation is total time and money waste...but anyways thank you so much for clearing my doubt your example is helpful :p

replies.author: Miaow
replies.text:
I'm surprised that you thought that calculus is a must for web development lol

Web development overall DO NOT REQUIRE MATH. math is entirely irrelevant in the web development world. 


Do you need a material science degree to be a blacksmith? Same logic applies to web development. Blacksmith uses his tools to make his crafts, similarly web developers use html, css, javascript, and etc to create their websites. How is math important here?

A blacksmith is valued for his skills in craftsmanship, not his understanding in the materials all the way to the atomic level. Similarly, web developers are valued for their website designing skills such as their competency in a framework such as React Js, not what is going on when the computer is compiling the code.

replies.text: @SLiME thanks mate

topLevelComment.author: TK
topLevelComment.text:
DO WE NEED CALCULUS, TRIGONOMETRY LIKE HIGHER MATH IN DATA ANALYTICS,IT OR IN FRONT END DEV 


I AM CALCULUS NOOB

replies.author: TK
replies.text: @Miaow yep thanks for answering!! Your answer is helpful :)

replies.author: Miaow
replies.text:
Data analyst don't need calculus lol. You only need basic statistics. Do you understand what's a standard deviation? Good now you're a potential data analyst.

Front end is web development. Math is absolutely not required, but you DO need to have a somewhat good art sense cuz you're dealing with DESIGNING a website. If you wanna be competitive, you can self teach yourself UX designing to upskill your front end skills. UX designing is absolutely not a requirement to be a front end dev, but it's a huge plus if you do know ux design. Your websites will be more aesthetically pleasing and user experience friendly if you learned a bit of ux designing
